required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Botulinum Toxin to Improve Cosmesis of Primary Cleft Lip Repair
clinical_study.official_title: Botulinum Toxin to Improve Cosmesis of Primary Cleft Lip Repair

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: Objective: To determine if the use of botulinum toxin during primary cleft lip repair improves the cosmetic appearance of the cleft lip scar

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Hypertrophic Scarring (HTS) as Assessed by Score on the Manchester Scar Scale (MSS) Rated by Blinded Plastic Surgeons
primary_outcome.description: The Manchester Scar Scale (MSS) assesses color match to surrounding skin, skin texture, contour, and distortion, and total MSS score ranges from 4 to 14, with a higher score indicating worse scarring. Scars were analyzed by three blinded plastic surgeons, who evaluated frontal and basal photographs of participants. The median of the three surgeon scores per participant was first calculated, and then the median all medians was calculated per arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Hypertrophic Scarring (HTS) as Assessed by Score on the Manchester Scar Scale (MSS) Rated by Blinded Plastic Surgeons
primary_outcome.description: The Manchester Scar Scale (MSS) assesses color match to surrounding skin, skin texture, contour, and distortion, and total MSS score ranges from 4 to 14, with a higher score indicating worse scarring. Scars were analyzed by three blinded plastic surgeons, who evaluated frontal and basal photographs of participants. The median of the three surgeon scores per participant was first calculated, and then the median all medians was calculated per arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Hypertrophic Scarring (HTS) as Assessed by Score on the Modified Scar Rating Scale (MSRS) Rated by Blinded Plastic Surgeons
primary_outcome.description: The Modified Scar Rating Scale (MSRS) assesses surface appearance, scar height, and color mismatch, and total MSRS score ranges from 3 to 12, with a higher score indicating worse scarring. Scars were analyzed by three blinded plastic surgeons, who evaluated frontal and basal photographs of participants. The median of the three surgeon scores per participant was first calculated, and then the median all medians was calculated per arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Hypertrophic Scarring (HTS) as Assessed by Score on the Modified Scar Rating Scale (MSRS) Rated by Blinded Plastic Surgeons
primary_outcome.description: The Modified Scar Rating Scale (MSRS) assesses surface appearance, scar height, and color mismatch, and total MSRS score ranges from 3 to 12, with a higher score indicating worse scarring. Scars were analyzed by three blinded plastic surgeons, who evaluated frontal and basal photographs of participants. The median of the three surgeon scores per participant was first calculated, and then the median all medians was calculated per arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Hypertrophic Scarring (HTS) as Assessed by Score on the Manchester Scar Scale (MSS) Rated by Crowdsourced Raters
primary_outcome.description: The Manchester Scar Scale (MSS) assesses color match to surrounding skin, skin texture, contour, and distortion, and total MSS score ranges from 4 to 14, with a higher score indicating worse scarring. Scars were analyzed by crowdsourced raters via Amazon Mechanical Turk. The crowdsourced raters evaluated frontal and basal photographs of participants. 100 unique responses were elicited per participant. The mean of all crowdsourced ratings for each arm is reported per arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Hypertrophic Scarring (HTS) as Assessed by Score on the Manchester Scar Scale (MSS) Rated by Crowdsourced Raters
primary_outcome.description: The Manchester Scar Scale (MSS) assesses color match to surrounding skin, skin texture, contour, and distortion, and total MSS score ranges from 4 to 14, with a higher score indicating worse scarring. Scars were analyzed by crowdsourced raters via Amazon Mechanical Turk. The crowdsourced raters evaluated frontal and basal photographs of participants. 100 unique responses were elicited per participant. The mean of all crowdsourced ratings for each arm is reported per arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Hypertrophic Scarring (HTS) as Assessed by Score on the Modified Scar Rating Scale (MSRS) Rated by Crowdsourced Raters
primary_outcome.description: The Modified Scar Rating Scale (MSRS) assesses surface appearance, scar height, and color mismatch, and total MSRS score ranges from 3 to 12, with a higher score indicating worse scarring. Scars were analyzed by crowdsourced raters via Amazon Mechanical Turk. The crowdsourced raters evaluated frontal and basal photographs of participants. 100 unique responses were elicited per participant. The mean of all crowdsourced ratings for each arm is reported per arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Hypertrophic Scarring (HTS) as Assessed by Score on the Modified Scar Rating Scale (MSRS) Rated by Crowdsourced Raters
primary_outcome.description: The Modified Scar Rating Scale (MSRS) assesses surface appearance, scar height, and color mismatch, and total MSRS score ranges from 3 to 12, with a higher score indicating worse scarring. Scars were analyzed by crowdsourced raters via Amazon Mechanical Turk. The crowdsourced raters evaluated frontal and basal photographs of participants. 100 unique responses were elicited per participant. The mean of all crowdsourced ratings for each arm is reported per arm.

arm_group.description: Injection of botulinum toxin into cleft lip at time of surgical repair.
Injection of normal saline into cleft lip at time of surgical repair.

intervention.description: Injection of botulinum toxin at the time of surgery at cleft lip repair site. Botulinum toxin will be injected intraoperatively at 4 standardized sites in the cleft lip during surgical repair.
Injection of normal saline into cleft lip at time of surgical repair. Saline will be injected intraoperatively at 4 standardized sites in the cleft lip during surgical repair.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- complete unilateral cleft lip with or without cleft palate
- planned for a primary cleft lip repair
Exclusion Criteria:
-bilateral cleft lip

reference.citation: Pascual-Pascual SI, Pascual-Castroviejo I. Safety of botulinum toxin type A in children younger than 2 years. Eur J Paediatr Neurol. 2009 Nov;13(6):511-5. doi: 10.1016/j.ejpn.2008.10.006. Epub 2008 Nov 25.
Galárraga IM. Use of botulinum toxin in cheiloplasty: A new method to decrease tension. Can J Plast Surg. 2009 Fall;17(3):e1-2.

Alvarez CM, De Vera MA, Chhina H, Williams L, Durlacher K, Kaga S. The use of botulinum type A toxin in the treatment of idiopathic clubfoot: 5-year follow-up. J Pediatr Orthop. 2009 Sep;29(6):570-5. doi: 10.1097/BPO.0b013e3181b2b3d4.
Gassner HG, Sherris DA, Friedman O. Botulinum toxin-induced immobilization of lower facial wounds. Arch Facial Plast Surg. 2009 Mar-Apr;11(2):140-2. doi: 10.1001/archfacial.2009.3.
Christiansen G, Mohney BG, Baratz KH, Bradley EA. Botulinum toxin for the treatment of congenital entropion. Am J Ophthalmol. 2004 Jul;138(1):153-5.
Sherris DA, Gassner HG. Botulinum toxin to minimize facial scarring. Facial Plast Surg. 2002 Feb;18(1):35-9.
Sykes JM. Management of the cleft lip deformity. Facial Plast Surg Clin North Am. 2001 Feb;9(1):37-50. Review.
Seibert RW. Bilateral cleft nasal repair. Facial Plast Surg. 2000;16(1):69-78. Review.
Millard DR Jr. Embryonic rationale for the primary correction of classical congenital clefts of the lip and palate. Ann R Coll Surg Engl. 1994 May;76(3):150-60. Review.
Witt PD, Hardesty RA. Rotation-advancement repair of the unilateral cleft lip. One center's perspective. Clin Plast Surg. 1993 Oct;20(4):633-45. Review.

Lee JS, Lee KB, Lee YR, Choi YN, Park CW, Park SD, Jung DH, Lee CS. Botulinum Toxin Treatment on Upper Limb Function in School Age Children With Bilateral Spastic Cerebral Palsy: One Year Follow-up. Ann Rehabil Med. 2013 Jun;37(3):328-35. doi: 10.5535/arm.2013.37.3.328. Epub 2013 Jun 30.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Botulinum Toxin
group.description: Injection of botulinum toxin into cleft lip at time of surgical repair. Botulinum Toxin Type A: Injection of botulinum toxin at the time of surgery at cleft lip repair site. Botulinum toxin will be injected intraoperatively at 4 standardized sites in the cleft lip during surgical repair.

group.title: Saline
group.description: Injection of normal saline into cleft lip at time of surgical repair. Normal Saline Injection: Injection of normal saline into cleft lip at time of surgical repair. Saline will be injected intraoperatively at 4 standardized sites in the cleft lip during surgical repair.

Number Who Completed the 12-month Follow up

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Number of Participants with Syndromic Cleft Lip
Number of Participants with Presurgical Nasoalveolar Molding (PNAM)
Number of Participants with Complete Cleft Lip

outcome.title: Hypertrophic Scarring (HTS) as Assessed by Score on the Manchester Scar Scale (MSS) Rated by Blinded Plastic Surgeons
outcome.description: The Manchester Scar Scale (MSS) assesses color match to surrounding skin, skin texture, contour, and distortion, and total MSS score ranges from 4 to 14, with a higher score indicating worse scarring. Scars were analyzed by three blinded plastic surgeons, who evaluated frontal and basal photographs of participants. The median of the three surgeon scores per participant was first calculated, and then the median all medians was calculated per arm.
outcome.population: Only 9 in the Botulinum Toxin arm and 11 in the Saline arm were analyzed for this outcome measure.

group.title: Botulinum Toxin

Scars were analyzed by three blinded plastic surgeons, who evaluated frontal and basal photographs of participants. The median of the three surgeon scores per participant was first calculated, and then the median all medians was calculated per arm.

outcome.title: Hypertrophic Scarring (HTS) as Assessed by Score on the Manchester Scar Scale (MSS) Rated by Crowdsourced Raters
outcome.description: The Manchester Scar Scale (MSS) assesses color match to surrounding skin, skin texture, contour, and distortion, and total MSS score ranges from 4 to 14, with a higher score indicating worse scarring. Scars were analyzed by crowdsourced raters via Amazon Mechanical Turk. The crowdsourced raters evaluated frontal and basal photographs of participants. 100 unique responses were elicited per participant. The mean of all crowdsourced ratings for each arm is reported per arm.
outcome.population: Only 9 in the Botulinum Toxin arm and 11 in the Saline arm were analyzed for this outcome measure.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Small sample size; inconsistency in acquiring post-op photos for some; 12 month analysis may be skewed by Botox's short duration of action; crowdsourced raters were not a generalized sample of the population

point_of_contact.organization: The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston
